citation.article-title: Conexibacter woesei gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel representative of a deep evolutionary line of descent within the class Actinobacteria
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Conexibacter (Co.nex.i.bac′ter. L. part. adj. conexus bound, tied; N.L. masc. n. bacter from Gr. n. baktron rod; N.L. masc. n. Conexibacter a rod that is bound).
Cells are small rods (0·6–0·7×0·9–1·2 μm), occurring singly or in pairs.
The peptidoglycan is of the A1γ type (based on meso-A2pm, direct cross-linkage).
The major isoprenoid quinone is menaquinone MK-7(H4).
The polar lipid pattern consists of phosphatidylinositol and an unidentified phospholipid; amino-functional lipids and glycolipids are absent.
The fatty acid profile is dominated by oleic, 14-methyl-pentadecanoic, hexadecanoic and ω6c-heptadecenoic acid.
The G+C content of the DNA is 71 mol%.
Phylogenetically, the genus is a member of the class Actinobacteria.
The type species is Conexibacter woesei.
